block.p: Dr. Judith Carol Berman and Prof. David Kohn are to be married today by Rabbi Judd K. Levingston at Congregation B'nai Jeshurun in New York.

The bride, who will continue to use her name professionally, is an account manager at Wall Street Systems, a software company in New York. She is also a research associate in anthropology at Hunter College in New York. She graduated from Hunter and received master's and doctoral degrees in anthropology from the Graduate Center of the City University. She is the daughter of Jeanette and Edward Berman of West Palm Beach, Fla.

She is the daughter of Jeanette and Edward Berman of West Palm Beach, Fla.

The bridegroom is the Robert Fisher Oxnam professor of science and society and the chairman of the history department at Drew University in Madison, N.J. A specialist in the work of Charles Darwin, he is a research fellow at the Charles Darwin Center in London and a visiting fellow at Clare Hall of Cambridge University. He graduated from Queens College and received a Ph.D. in botany from the University of Massachusetts. He is the son of the late Karoline and Leslie Kohn.
The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce, as did the bridegroom's.
